poker

Class TwitterStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • poker.TwitterStream
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LocalStream

    public class TwitterStream
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a Twitter conversation between the application and a user. Contains attributes for the Twitter class, the most recent Status sent in the conversation, the User in this conversation and two strings containing the message to send in the next tweet, and a tweet ID to prevent duplicate statuses.
    Author:
    Dara Callinan, Jazheel Luna, Eoghan O'Donnell, Crischelle Pana

    • Constructor Detail

      • TwitterStream

        TwitterStream(twitter4j.Twitter twitter,
              twitter4j.Status status,
              twitter4j.User user,
              int streamID)
        Class constructor. Initialises the twitter, most recent status, and user attributes. Sets the toSend string to an empty string, and gets a starting tweet ID.
        Parameters:
        twitter - The Twitter object to be used.
        status - The initial Status.
        user - The User in the conversation.
        streamID - The two character ID of the conversation.

    • Method Detail

      • addToTweet

        public void addToTweet(java.lang.String string)
        Adds a String to the current output message that has not yet been sent. If adding the string would make the tweet too long, sendTweet(java.lang.String) is called, and the current message is emptied. The string is then added to the message. If the initial string exceeds the character limit then the string will be broken up into multiple tweets.
        Parameters:
        string - The String to be added to the current output message.
        See Also:
        sendTweet(String)

      • completeMessage

        public void completeMessage()
        Sends whatever the current message is, as long as it is not empty.

      • updateTweetID

        private void updateTweetID()

      • sendTweet

        private void sendTweet(java.lang.String str)
                throws twitter4j.TwitterException,
                       java.lang.InterruptedException
        Sends a tweet containing an identifier followed by a String.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to be sent.
        Throws:
        twitter4j.TwitterException - If API request is denied.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If thread is interrupted.

      • getRecentReply

        private twitter4j.Status getRecentReply()
                                 throws twitter4j.TwitterException,
                                        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Gets the most recent statuses from the user, and returns one if it is in reply to the most recent status in the twitter stream.
        Returns:
        The user's status replying to the most recent status if one exists.
        Throws:
        twitter4j.TwitterException - If the API request is denied.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.

      • parseResponse

        public java.lang.String parseResponse()
                               throws twitter4j.TwitterException,
                                      java.lang.InterruptedException
        Continuously checks for a reply to the latest tweet, by the user and returns a String of the text of the reply status if it finds one.
        Returns:
        The text of a reply by the user to the latest tweet.
        Throws:
        twitter4j.TwitterException - If the API request is denied.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.

      • tweetStatus

        private static twitter4j.Status tweetStatus(twitter4j.Twitter tw,
                                            twitter4j.StatusUpdate s)
                                     throws twitter4j.TwitterException,
                                            java.lang.InterruptedException
        Tweets a status update. Returns the newly made status.
        Parameters:
        tw - The Twitter object used by this stream.
        s - The StatusUpdate object to be updated.
        Returns:
        The new status.
        Throws:
        twitter4j.TwitterException - If the API request is denied.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.

      • getTimeline

        private static twitter4j.ResponseList<twitter4j.Status> getTimeline(twitter4j.Twitter tw,
                                                                    java.lang.String user,
                                                                    int tweetsToCheck)
                                                             throws twitter4j.TwitterException,
                                                                    java.lang.InterruptedException
        Gets a certain number of newest tweets from a user's timeline.
        Parameters:
        tw - The Twitter object used by this stream.
        user - The user whose timeline will be retrieved.
        tweetsToCheck - The number of statuses to get.
        Returns:
        A list of statuses made by the user.
        Throws:
        twitter4j.TwitterException - If the API request is denied.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.
